014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017import java.lang.annotation.Repeatable;
018import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
019import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
020import java.lang.annotation.Target;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal.OutParameterFactory;
023
024/**
025 * Declare a named out parameter on an {@code @SqlCall} annotated method.
026 * Note that you *must* include the parameter name in the SQL text to
027 * ensure that the binding is activated, this is a limitation that
028 * may be fixed at a future date.
029 *
030 * Example usage, using PostgreSQL call syntax:
031 * <pre>
032 *   handle.execute("CREATE FUNCTION set100(OUT outparam INT) AS $$ BEGIN outparam := 100; END; $$ LANGUAGE plpgsql");
033 *
034 *   &#64;SqlCall("{call myStoredProc(:outparam)}")
035 *   &#64;OutParameter(name="outparam", sqlType = Types.INTEGER)
036 *   OutParameters callStoredProc();
037 * </pre>
038 */
039@SqlStatementCustomizingAnnotation(OutParameterFactory.class)
040@Target(ElementType.METHOD)
041@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
042@Repeatable(OutParameterList.class)
043public @interface OutParameter {
044    String name();
045    int sqlType();
046}
